com.versant.event
Class EventClient

java.lang.Object
  com.versant.event.EventClient

public class EventClient
extends java.lang.Object

The EventClient represents a connection with an "event daemon." The event daemon is a separate process that reads events from the Versant ODBMS server as they are generated. When the event daemon receives an event, it "broadcasts" the event on one or more named channels. Each EventClient can service multiple channel subscribers, each receiving their own notification of various database events.

Constructor Detail

EventClient

public EventClient(java.lang.String daemonHost,
                   int daemonPort,
                   java.lang.String clientHost,
                   int clientPort,
                   java.lang.String databaseName)
            throws java.io.IOException
Constructs an EventClient using the specified Daemon host name, Daemon port, client host name,client port and the database information. The constructor attempts to establish a connection to the VERSANT Event Daemon supposed to be running on daemonHost and listening for channel management commands on daemonPort. If the connect fails because the daemon is not running a java.net.ConnectException is thrown. The constructor also attempts to set up a ServerSocket on the clientHost at the clientPort to listen for Event Notifications. If the clientPort specified is already in use, then a java.net.BindException is thrown.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
Method Detail

newChannel

public EventChannel newChannel(java.lang.String name,
                               ChannelBuilder cb)
                        throws java.io.IOException
Creates an event channel with the given name. The channel is also defined with the event daemon. Besides the channel name, the properties of the new channel to be created must be specified in the form of a channel builder object. The channel builder object could be any of ClassChannelBuilder, QueryChannelBuilder or ObjectChannelBuilder.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

getChannel

public EventChannel getChannel(java.lang.String name)
                        throws java.io.IOException
Obtains an existing event channel by name. If no such event channel exists, the event daemon is queried to check if such a channel has been defined before. If the channel has been defined before, a new event channel object corresponding to the channel defined with the event daemon is returned. Currently the channel properties cannot be queried or modified.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

removeFromChannel

public void removeFromChannel(java.lang.String channelName)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Removes association of this client from the channel given by channelName. Once the client is dis-associated with the channel, it will not receive any events on this channel.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

addExceptionListener

public void addExceptionListener(ExceptionListener listener)
Add an exception listener to the client. This listener will listen for exceptions that are thrown when the connection to the server is lost either due to a server shutdown or kill.

removeExceptionListener

public void removeExceptionListener(ExceptionListener listener)
Remove an exception listener that was previously added. Once a listener is removed it will no longer be notified about exceptions that are thrown when the connection to the server is lost either due to a server shutdown or kill.

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Shuts down the event client. After this method is called, no more events will be received or delivered by the event client. Note that all channels that were created by this client will continue to exist until they are explicitly deleted.

raiseEvent

public void raiseEvent(java.lang.Object definer,
                       java.lang.Object raiser,
                       int eventType,
                       java.lang.String raiserInfo)
Raises an user-defined event. For regular system events, the various event properties (such as the definer and raiser objects) are set automatically. With user-defined events these properties can be controlled explicitly.

Parameters:
definer - A persistent object (a Handle in Fundamental JVI or persistent Java object in Transparent JVI). This object can be accessed with the VersantEventObject.getObjectDefinedOn() method.
raiser - A persistent object (a Handle in Fundamental JVI or persistent Java object in Transparent JVI). This object can be accessed with the VersantEventObject.getObjectRaisedOn() method.
eventType - An user-defined event type, which can be any non-negative integer.
raiserInfo - An user-defined string that can be accessed with the VersantEventObject.getRaiserInfo() method.

getdbName

public java.lang.String getdbName()
Return the name of the database this client is associated with.
